instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2879: What is 820-2879? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> panic error
threads.message: This board start to load OS X and crash with panic kernel error. I tried usb drive and sata drive. Anything I can try? Another bios or any common problem?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> panic error
threads.message: Usually bad RAM or bad RAM stick. Try one RAM stick in one slot at a time. Could also be the SATA cable if it says no OS set

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> panic error
threads.message: Already tested the ram. And it is NOT sata cable. Same error with usb drive as I said.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> panic error
threads.message: Metal sponge thing on the airport cable shorting out the pins on the connector because the tape is missing is common. Also 1 bad RAM slot, usually the one closest to the keyboard.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> panic error
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> panic error
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> panic error
threads.message: Yes the wifi/camera connector. Disconnect it and see if problem goes away.
